titles.title: Cardfight!! Vanguard: Legion Mate Hen
カードファイト!! ヴァンガード レギオンメイト編
CARDFIGHT!! ヴァンガード レギオンメイト編
卡片战斗先导者 双斗盟友篇

anime.description: Several days after the mortal battle against Link Joker which embroils the whole world, the world has returned to peace. But http://anidb.net/ch25901 [Kai Toshiki] faces a surprising situation. http://anidb.net/ch25900 [Sendou Aichi], who saved the world from the invasion of Link Joker, has suddenly disappeared. In addition, everyone`s memory of Aichi is lost... Almost all hints have been lost, and Kai starts to search Aichi with http://anidb.net/ch27146 [Blaster Blade] and the deck of Royal Paladin, the only existing hint and the proof of their bonds. Kai is approached by fighters who call themselves Quatre Knights. The four — http://anidb.net/ch65689 [Gaillard], http://anidb.net/ch65690 [Neve], http://anidb.net/ch65691 [Ratie] and http://anidb.net/ch65692 [Sera] — are fighters who control mysterious powers in vanguard fights, and urge Kai to give up searching for Aichi. What is their goal, though? And what is their relationship with Aichi? Kai, with the new power Legion in his hand, fights to find Aichi. Source: Cardfight!! Vanguard Wikia

tag.name: shounen
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shounen, literally meaning "youth" and often also specifically "boy", refers to a male audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: game
tag.description: Based on an interactive (even if minimally so) form of entertainment software, generally available for PCs, consoles or arcade machines.

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: adventure
tag.description: Adventures are exciting stories, with new experiences or exotic locales. Adventures are designed to provide an action-filled, energetic experience for the viewer. Rather than the predominant emphasis on violence and fighting that is found in pure action anime, however, the viewer of adventures can live vicariously through the travels, conquests, explorations, creation of empires, struggles and situations that confront the main characters, actual historical figures or protagonists. Under the category of adventures, we can include traditional swashbucklers, serialized films, and historical spectacles, searches or expeditions for lost continents, "jungle" and "desert" epics, treasure hunts and quests, disaster films, and heroic journeys or searches for the unknown. Adventure films are often, but not always, set in an historical period, and may include adapted stories of historical or literary adventure heroes, kings, battles, rebellion, or piracy.

tag.name: proxy battles
tag.description: In our terms, a proxy battle is a battle where humans use creatures/robots to do the fighting for them, either by commanding those creatures/robots or by simply evolving them/changing them into battle mode. Often the training aspect is also involved, or in some cases the proxies are nothing more than holographic representatives of some other variation of competition (like for example a card game). While many popular shounen anime fit under this category, it`s not limited to shounen anime.

tag.name: sports
tag.description: Sports anime revolves around a recreational physical activity or skill. In addition they often adhere to certain genre conventions, the emphasis on training and practice in preparation for competition, characters desire for self improvement, and pursuit of a specific goal.

tag.name: card games
tag.description: A card game is any game using playing cards as the primary device with which the game is played, be they traditional or game-specific. Countless card games exist, including families of related games (such as poker). A small number of card games played with traditional decks have formally standardized rules, but most are folk games whose rules vary by region, culture, and person. Many games that are not generally placed in the family of card games do in fact use cards for some aspect of their gameplay. Similarly, some games that are placed in the card game genre involve a board. The distinction is that the gameplay of a card game primarily depends on the use of the cards by players (the board is simply a guide for scorekeeping or for card placement), while board games (the principal non-card game genre to use cards) generally focus on the players` positions on the board, and use the cards for some secondary purpose.

episode.title: 消えた先導者
The Missing Leader
Kieta Sendousha
episode.summary: Aichi is nowhere to be found, but what`s even more frustrating for Kai is that no one remembers him, not even his own family! Have Aichi`s other friends totally forgotten about him or are there still glimmers of memory that can be unearthed? Determined to find out, Kai fights Naoki... for the first time?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 双闘[レギオン]
Legion
Legion
episode.summary: Now two people remember the otherwise-forgotten Aichi: Kai and Naoki. Can they succeed in reviving Misaki`s memories through a Vanguard fight? And what is the secret of Kai`s new move, Legion? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: アイチの影
Aichi`s Shadow
Aichi no Kage
episode.summary: Only Kai, Naoki, and Misaki remember Aichi and they vow to find him, but are stumped. But then Morris, an enigmatic steward, appears in front of Naoki. As Morris engages in a Cardfight with Naoki, he tries to use the latter`s anxiety to win the fight and throw him into despair. But who is Morris and his unseen master? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: シーク・ザ・メイト
Seek the Mate
Seek the Mate
episode.summary: Kai continues his quest to find more "mates" who will remember Aichi`s existence. Next up is Miwa, who`s known Aichi since the first time he stepped into Card Capital. In order to jolt Miwa`s memories, Kai tries to re-enact his first epic battle with Aichi! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ナオキの拳
Naoki`s Fist
Naoki no Kobushi
episode.summary: The small group of Cardfighters who remember Aichi need one more member before they begin their search for him. Will Kamui be the one? Even though he should be satisfied in this "new world," he feels like something is missing. Naoki takes Kamui on to get him to remember, but Kamui just can`t seem to recall the fighter he once admired... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 青き炎のガイヤール
Blue Flames Gaillard
Aoki Honoo no Gaillard
episode.summary: While chasing down a clue about Aichi`s disappearance at Psy, Kai meets Olivier Gaillard of the mysterious group Quatre Knights. Gaillard wants Kai to forget all about Aichi... and, as they fight, he claims that he represents Aichi`s will! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 鋼のネーヴ
Steel Neve
Hagane no Neve
episode.summary: The wounded Kai tries to warn his mates about the Quatre Knights who are hunting them down, but it`s too late. Ishida is confronted by another member, Neve. Ishida is confident at first, since he`s already beaten the Knight named Moress, but then Neve encloses them inside his Steel Wall Prison, a place that can do real physical damage to the loser of a Cardfight! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 先導者・櫂
The Leader, Kai
Sendousha Kai
episode.summary: Kai decides to continue the quest for Aichi and face the Quatre Knights on his own so his friends won`t get hurt or worse, but Kamui stands in his way. Kamui and the others are willing to brave danger for Aichi`s sake, whatever Kai says. Kamui throws down the gauntlet to begin an epic card fight over their future course of action. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: グレートダイカイザー見参!
Introducing Great Daikaiser!
Great Daikaiser Kenzan!
episode.summary: Kamui and Misaki go to the airport to meet the jetsetting Koutei for info on the Quatre Knights, but why doesn`t he remember his old friends and rivals? Then, two more international Vanguard fighters show up. Are they the other two ultra-powerful members of Quatre Four? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 幻影のラティ
Illusional Rati
Gen`ei no Rati
episode.summary: It`s Misaki`s turn to fight one of the Quatre Knights! Her opponent is Rati, who acts like a lightweight, but is a seriously powerful fighter. Misaki feels stronger because of the bond of friendship with Aichi, but Rati claims that`s just an illusion! Judgment awaits inside the Fairy Masquerade Prison! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 凍てつく氷のセラ
Freezing Ice Serra
Itetsuku Koori no Sera
episode.summary: Will Kamui be able to break the mates` losing streak against the Quatre Knights, or will Judgment come down upon him, too? The only way to get to the not-so-long-lost Aichi is confirmed for Misaki and Kamui. Meanwhile, perhaps persistence will pay off when Kai visits Ren once more to ask about Aichi! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: レンの約束
Ren`s Promise
Ren no Yakusoku
episode.summary: Ren definitely knows more than he`s telling about Aichi and the Quatre Knights, but the only way Kai can get any information is by beating Ren in a Cardfight. Will Ren shut down Kai and his mates or will they get their first valuable clue to Aichi`s whereabouts? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: アイチの戻る場所
The Place Where Aichi Will Return
Aichi no Modoru Basho
episode.summary: Kai and his fellow mates continue the search for Aichi. They follow up on the clue that Ren gave them, arriving at a Stonehenge-esque like location in Japan. Among the ancient ruins, Ishida fights Gaillard, and when that battle royale is over, another opponent appears, one who startles them all! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 告げられた真実
The Announced Truth
Tsugerareta Shinjitsu
episode.summary: Kourin materializes next to Gaillard, but this former friend of Kai and the gang is now their ardent enemy. As Kai battles Kourin, she not only reveals herself to be one of Aichi`s current "guardians," but also shares a shocking truth that none of the Card Capital regulars want to hear! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 風の待つ島
Island Awaiting the Wind
Kaze no Matsu Shima
episode.summary: Kai and friends decide the only way they can get strong enough to defeat the Quatre Knights is through intensive training... but who is both strong enough, available, and willing to train them? Leon Souryu! So they travel to Leon`s isolated island, where an important lesson is waiting for Ishida. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 櫂の意志
Kai`s Will
Kai no Ishi
episode.summary: As the intensive training retreat continues on Leon`s island, Ishida and Kamui keep making progress, but the wind seems to have been taken out of Kai`s sails. Will Kai recover, or instead listen to his old friend and give up the search altogether? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 聖域への扉
Gateway to Sanctuary
Seiiki e no Tobira
episode.summary: Ishida discovers the gateway to the Quatre Knights` base... which means Aichi must be there! Although it may be a trap, Ishida and the gang step right up... and learn more of Aichi`s circumstances as well as the serious consequences of losing a fight in their "sanctuary"! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 男気爆発[ビッグバン]
Manly Big Bang
Otokogi Big Bang
episode.summary: Will Ishida be the first person to take down one of the Quatre Knights? Or will he be the first to lose his memories of Aichi all over again? Both Kai and the gang and the rest of the Quatre Knights anxiously awaiting the outcome! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 鋼の意志
Steel Will
Hagane no Ishi
episode.summary: Miwa is in a hurry to get to Aichi, but his path is blocked by one of the Quatre Knights... Philip Neve! Even though the two of them fight one another fiercely, Miwa seems to be overwhelmed by the size of Neve`s burdens. What is the bitter, hidden past of Neve, the steel warrior?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: かわらないもの
What Doesn`t Change
Kawaranai Mono
episode.summary: Rati claims that everything on Earth is a mirage. The only things important to her are the world of Cray and Aichi, who protected that land. Sparks fly when she has a fateful rematch with Misaki. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 青き炎の誓い
Vow of the Blue Flames
Aoki Honoo no Chikai
episode.summary: Kamui is on his own when he`s confronted by the master of blue flames, Olivier Gaillard. As the two fight, Kamui`s passionate feelings overwhelm Gaillard, but the Quatre Knight also has a good reason to be protective of Aichi... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 煉獄の炎
Flames of Perdition
Rengoku no Honoo
episode.summary: Gaillard swore absolute allegiance to Aichi and is more passionate about it than the others. The story of how he became one of the Quatre Knights is revealed here, and his battle with Kai runs its fateful course... to an unexpected conclusion! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 解かれた眠り
Interrupted Sleep
Tokareta Nemuri
episode.summary: Serra`s treachery awakens Aichi from the seals, but it`s not the Aichi Kai and the others want to meet! Meanwhile, Kai, Naoki, and Gaillard are trapped in Serra`s ice prison, while the traitorous Quatre Knight dupes Neve into fighting a possessed Aichi! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: アイチ覚醒
Aichi Awakens
Aichi Kakusei
episode.summary: Aichi is possessed by the "seed" form of Link Joker! The duplicitous Serra has tricked noble Neve into fighting Aichi. The new Link Joker deck has the Quatre Knight on the ropes, but Neve is as clever as he is honorable. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 冷たい野望
Cold Ambition
Tsumetai Yabou
episode.summary: Ren and Leon come to Kai`s rescue, but why did they refuse Aichi`s request to join the Quatre Knights? Meanwhile, Rati is the last person standing between Serra and Aichi. If she fails, Aichi and the Link Joker seed within him will be fully released from the seals... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 俺たちの場所
Our Place
Oretachi no Basho
episode.summary: With Raul Serra out of the way, the truce between Team Kai and the Quatre Knights is over! To protect Aichi, Kourin steps up to face her former friends. Ishida fights her Link Joker deck with his best deck yet, and he argues that they all belong back home. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 青き炎の決意
Determination of the Bluish Flames
Aoki Honoo no Ketsui
episode.summary: Gaillard is the only remaining person who can protect Aichi from the traitorous Knight, Serra. But can even a fighter of Gaillard`s caliber beat the odds with three units permanently locked? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 復活のオメガ
Omega`s Return
Fukkatsu no Omega
episode.summary: Quatre Knights traitor and evil mastermind Serra is all set to fight Aichi in his weakened condition in a bid to host the powerful Link Joker seed, but he`s interrupted at the last second by Kai and company. Gaillard feels responsible and steps up to stop his former comrade, but can anyone beat Serra when he uses his true Link Joker deck, with Omega Locks? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 炎の意地
Pride of the Flames
Honoo no Iji
episode.summary: On behalf of the Quatre Knights, Gaillard apologizes to Aichi for letting him down, but asks for one more chance to beat Kai and company so that Aichi and the Link Joker force within him can be sealed away again. Kai battles the prince of bluish flames, but between unleashing Link Joker again and locking Aichi away forever, can there really be a winner? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 破滅の剣
Sword of Destruction
Hametsu no Tsurugi
episode.summary: At long last, Kai faces off against Aichi! But if Kai loses, he, Ren, Leon, and Naoki will become the new Quatre Knights to watch over a sealed Aichi! On top of that, Aichi whips out his powerful, corrupted avatar... Blaster Joker! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 勇気の剣
Sword of Courage
Yuuki no Tsurugi
episode.summary: The ultimate battle between Kai and Aichi ends here! Kai vows to seal himself away if he wins and the Link Joker seed moves to him. Is there a way out of this vicious cycle?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 旅立ちの季節
A Season of Journeys
Tabidachi no Kisetsu
episode.summary: A year has passed since Aichi and company returned from the moonbase sanctuary. Aichi and Naoki are going to be seniors, while Kai, Misaki, and others are graduating. What lies in their future? What paths will they choose? Aichi is dying to ask Kai those questions, but can`t seem to find him... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 先導者たち
Leaders
Sendousha-tachi
episode.summary: Aichi and the gang`s last hurrah! Following Kai and Misaki`s high school graduation ceremonies, Card Capital plays host to a shop tournament that draws all of the local Cardfighters, and then some. Plus a preview of the next generation of Cardfighters! Source: crunchyroll
